intro: Erigeron vicarius, commonly known as the common blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Erigeron vicarius is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
